senses.sense_definition: A long, flat surface in a shop, bank, or kitchen, used for serving customers, working, or preparing food.

examples.text: She placed her basket on the <w>counter</w> and took out her wallet.
Please wipe the kitchen <w>counter</w> with a damp cloth after cooking.

senses.sense_definition: An electronic or mechanical device, or a computer variable, that counts and displays a number.

examples.text: The Geiger <w>counter</w> began to click loudly as we approached the source.
We installed a visitor <w>counter</w> on the website to track traffic.

senses.sense_definition: A small object, such as a flat disc, used to mark a player's position or keep score in board games.

examples.text: Move your <w>counter</w> three spaces forward on the board.
Each player chooses a colored <w>counter</w> at the start of the game.

senses.sense_definition: A quick attack or move made in response to an opponent's action, especially in sports.

examples.text: The team defended well and then scored a brilliant goal on the <w>counter</w>.
He waited for his opponent to strike before launching a powerful <w>counter</w>.

senses.sense_definition: To react to something with an opposing opinion, action, or argument; to defend against something.

examples.text: The government has taken new measures to <w>counter</w> the rising inflation.
She <w>countered</w> his criticism by pointing out the success of the project.

senses.sense_definition: In a direction or manner that opposes or conflicts with something.

examples.text: His recent behavior runs <w>counter</w> to the school's code of conduct.
The results of the experiment ran <w>counter</w> to our initial expectations.
We need to consider the <w>counter</w> arguments before making a final decision.
The <w>counter</w> view suggests that the economy is actually improving.
Mr. <w>Counter</w> will be leading the meeting today.
I was introduced to a woman named Sarah <w>Counter</w>.
